intro: Hieracium nudonigricans, commonly known as the black-veined hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems covered in fine hairs. Its leaves are lance-shaped, with a rough texture and prominent veins, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in clusters. Hieracium nudonigricans thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in meadows and along roadsides.
